Class PlayMenu

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Frame
            • javax.swing.JFrame
              • MainGui
                • PlayMenu
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    HideMenu, java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants
    public class PlayMenu
extends MainGui
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.event.KeyListener, HideMenu
    This method will create the game board It will create the snake and the cherries It extends the MainGui class and implements ActionListener, KeyListener and HideMenu
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      PlayMenu()
      PlayMenu Constructor It wil set the title of the gui It will add the PlayPanel class as the default panel for this gui It will add a keyListener to the gui It calls the gameBegins method

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void actionPerformed​(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
      This method will run every game loop because it is tied to the timer It will repaint the whole panel every game loop
      private void collisionWithCherry()
      This method is used to increase the score and the tail length when the snake collects a cherry It will also move the cherry to a new random location on the map
      void gameBegins()
      This method sets all the variables at the start of the game It will clear any extra parts of the snake at the beginning of the game It will set a start point for the head and cherry It will start the timer so the ame can begin
      private void gameOver()
      This method is used to determine when the game is over
      void hideMenu()
      This method when called will hide the active menu
      private static void increaseSpeed()
      This method will call the methods from the ControlSpeed class to determine the speed of the snake when the score increases.
      void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      The keyPressed method will read in the key pressed by the user and will determine what direction the snake will move in It will also determine when the game will start playing
      void keyReleased​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)  
      void keyTyped​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)  
      static void playAudio​(java.lang.String path)
      Code researched and written by John Brosnan who sent it on for use with the audio aspects of the project

      • gameBegins

        public void gameBegins()
        This method sets all the variables at the start of the game It will clear any extra parts of the snake at the beginning of the game It will set a start point for the head and cherry It will start the timer so the ame can begin

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed​(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        The keyPressed method will read in the key pressed by the user and will determine what direction the snake will move in It will also determine when the game will start playing

      • collisionWithCherry

        private void collisionWithCherry()
        This method is used to increase the score and the tail length when the snake collects a cherry It will also move the cherry to a new random location on the map

      • gameOver

        private void gameOver()
        This method is used to determine when the game is over

      • increaseSpeed

        private static void increaseSpeed()
        This method will call the methods from the ControlSpeed class to determine the speed of the snake when the score increases. It will cal different methods depending on the difficulty level
